author: yobyot
body: The [PowerShell 7 preview 6](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/powershell/powershell-7-preview-6/) announcement mentions improvements in `Out-GridView` and [links to the doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.utility/out-gridview?view=powershell-7) which says that `ogv` is in `Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility`. However, `Out-GridView` is not among the exported commands in `Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility`. See attached image. Thanks!

comments.author: ili101
comments.body:
Are you on windows?

> This cmdlet was reintroduced in PowerShell 7. This cmdlet is only available on Windows systems that support the Windows Desktop.

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as answered and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

comments.author: yobyot
comments.body: Sorry, but I don't see a resolution here at all. Neither the doc nor the repo have been updated to resolve this issue.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@yobyot the Out-GridView cmdlet was only reintroduced for Windows as is mentioned in the docs page you linked (see the `Note` in the Description section). On a Windows installation of PowerShell, the cmdlet is in the `Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility` module.

If you would like to work with `Out-GridView` on other platforms, you can use the `GraphicalTools` module from the PSGallery which implements a similar cmdlet on the cross-platform AvaloniaUI framework. 🙂

title: Doc says Out-GridView is in Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility but module doesn't contain the cmdlet
